name: result::Result::<T, E>::unwrap_err_unchecked

result::Result: Unknown([Downcast(VariantIdx(1, ThreadLocalIndex)), Field(0, Ty { id: 1784, kind: Param(ParamTy { index: 1, name: "E" }) })])

doc:
Returns the contained [`Err`] value, consuming the `self` value,
 without checking that the value is not an [`Ok`].

 # Safety

 Calling this method on an [`Ok`] is *[undefined behavior]*.

 [undefined behavior]: https://doc.rust-lang.org/reference/behavior-considered-undefined.html

 # Examples

 ```no_run
 let x: Result<u32, &str> = Ok(2);
 unsafe { x.unwrap_err_unchecked() }; // Undefined behavior!
 ```

 ```
 let x: Result<u32, &str> = Err("emergency failure");
 assert_eq!(unsafe { x.unwrap_err_unchecked() }, "emergency failure");
 ```
